content.question: Given that y(1) = −3 and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ECE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, what is the approximation for y(2) if Euler’s method is used with a step size of 0.5, starting at x = 1 ?

topic.text: 7.5: (BC ONLY) Approximating Solutions Using Euler's Method

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
